intro: Dillwynia stipulifera, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dillwynia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, linear leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in open woodlands and heathlands, thriving in full sun to partial shade conditions.
